source: ## World Health data to UK health data transformation and writing into delta table

%%pyspark

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType, DoubleType


schema_name = 'warehouse'
table_name = 'uk_health_data'

# Read from staging
resultDF = spark.sql('SELECT year,health_exp as health_exp_percentage_gdp,life_expect, maternal_mortality,infant_mortality,neonatal_mortality, under_5_mortality   FROM `default`.`worldhealthdata` where country_code = "GBR"')

# Convert 'year' column to integer
resultDF = resultDF.withColumn("year", resultDF["year"].cast(IntegerType()))

columns = ["year", "health_exp_percentage_gdp", "life_expect", "maternal_mortality", "infant_mortality", "neonatal_mortality", "under_5_mortality"]

# Convert all other columns to double
for col in columns[1:]:
    resultDF = resultDF.withColumn(col, F.col(col).cast(DoubleType()))

# Fill null values using window function
for col in columns[1:]:
    window_spec = Window.orderBy("year").rowsBetween(Window.unboundedPreceding, Window.currentRow)
    resultDF = resultDF.withColumn(col, F.last(F.col(col), ignorenulls=True).over(window_spec))



# Create schema if does not exists 
spark_sql_schema_Create = f"CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS {schema_name};"
spark.sql(spark_sql_schema_Create)
# Write as delta 
resultDF.write.format("delta").mode("ignore").saveAsTable(f"{schema_name}.{table_name}")
# Select data 
df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `warehouse`.`uk_health_data`")

df.show(24)

%%pyspark

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType, DoubleType


schema_name = 'warehouse'
table_name = 'uk_ghed_data'

# Read from staging
resultDF = spark.sql('SELECT * FROM `default`.`ghed_data`')

# Convert 'year' column to integer
resultDF = resultDF.withColumn("year", resultDF["year"].cast(IntegerType()))


# Create schema if does not exists 
spark_sql_schema_Create = f"CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS {schema_name};"
spark.sql(spark_sql_schema_Create)
# Write as delta 
resultDF.write.format("delta").mode("ignore").saveAsTable(f"{schema_name}.{table_name}")
# Select data 
df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `warehouse`.`uk_ghed_data`")

df.show(24)

%%pyspark

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType, DoubleType


schema_name = 'warehouse'
table_name = 'uk_ghed_data_codes'

# Read from staging
resultDF = spark.sql('SELECT * FROM `default`.`ghed_data_codes`')

def sanitize_column_name(col_name, max_length=100):
    """
    Replaces invalid characters with underscores and truncates long names.

    Invalid characters: ' ,;{}()\n\t='
    """
    invalid_chars = ' ,;{}()\n\t='
    sanitized = ''.join('_' if c in invalid_chars else c for c in col_name)
    sanitized = ''.join(c if c.isalnum() or c == '_' else '_' for c in sanitized) #Ensure only alnum and underscore are present.
    return sanitized[:max_length]


new_columns = [sanitize_column_name(col) for col in resultDF.columns]
resultDF = resultDF.toDF(*new_columns)


# Create schema if does not exists 
spark_sql_schema_Create = f"CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS {schema_name};"
spark.sql(spark_sql_schema_Create)
# Write as delta 
resultDF.write.format("delta").mode("ignore").saveAsTable(f"{schema_name}.{table_name}")
# Select data 
df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `warehouse`.`uk_ghed_data_codes`")

df.show(24)
